description: A collection of circles in a formation shaped like half of a bowtie, with the rounded end in the top left corner, taping toward the middle, and then flaring out again into a rectangular shape in the bottom right corner. Each circle has a different number in the center denoting how many lines stem from that point. There is a thin brown triangle in the center of the rounded end of the formation and a large pale blue triangle at the bottom of the rectangular end.

author.name: VertexArchive
author.description: An UNOFFICIAL archive of the New York Times' Vertex puzzle. This account is not affiliated with the NY Times. I just like the triangles.
